page.title: 20Transport in Wootton Bassett
page.content: { The Railway at Wootton Bassett.} The Western Region main line from Swindon to Bath and Bristol passes through Wootton Bassett,although the town does not have a station of its own.A campaign to re-open the station for a commuter train service to Swindon has been started this year.The junction of lines to Bath & Bristol is west of the old station site. These routes are used by high speed Inter- City 125 trains. { Roads around Wootton Bassett.} Wootton Bassett High Street is part of the A3102 road that links the town to Swindon and the M4 to the east and Lyneham & Chippenham to the south west. { The old canal. } The old disused Wilts & Berks Canal can be traced just south of the town. Bridge House was beside the canal.
